target_groups.name: Atlassian Forge
target_groups.description_html:
Atlassian Forge is an app development platform designed to revolutionize how Atlassian cloud products are customized, extended, and integrated.

More information on the platform can be found here: https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/forge/

Due to the collaborative nature of Atlassian products, we are not interested in vulnerabilities surrounding enumeration and information gathering (being able to work effectively as a team is the purpose of our products). Instead, we're more interested in vulnerabilities that can have a direct impact to the Forge Platform. Below is a list of some of the vulnerability classes that we are seeking reports for:

  • Forge Platform
  • Execution environment
  • Sandbox escapes
  • Supporting GraphQL endpoints
  • Access Control Vulnerabilities (Insecure Direct Object Reference issues, etc)
  • Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
  • Forge CLI - https://www.npmjs.com/package/@forge/cli
  • Deployments
  • Forge App Installation/Uninstallation flows
  • UI Kit Stored/Reflected Cross-site Scripting (XSS) specifically targeting default behaviors of UI Kit elements

targets.name: Any customer instance. Do not test customer instances or affect customer data. Customer cloud instances may be in the form of <customer>.atlassian.net or <customer>.jira.com. Test only your own instances.
Any repository that you are not an owner of - do not impact Atlassian customers in any way.
First and third party apps and plugins from the marketplace are excluded from this bounty but may be in scope for https://bugcrowd.com/atlassianapps
HipChat (inc. HipChat Data Center, HipChat Desktop, HipChat Mobile)
Stride (inc. Stride Video, Stride Desktop, Stride Mobile)

name: Upwork
tagline: Upwork invites researchers to test our marketplace and apps to ensure a secure, vulnerability-free platform for our users

name: Atlassian-Built Apps
tagline: Marketplace apps officially developed and supported by Atlassian

target_groups.name: Preinstalled Apps in Jira and Confluence
target_groups.description_html:
Some Connect apps are installed by default in all cloud instances of Confluence and Jira. These apps are referred to as Preinstalled/System apps. These apps are restricted to site-admins of the instance and cannot be deleted as they are integral parts of the system.

Note: Not all target apps listed below have a Marketplace listing, please use these instructions on how to find a preinstalled/system app on Jira or Confluence instance if the target app is hidden on marketplace.

target_groups.name: Trello Power Ups (Made by Trello)
target_groups.description_html:
Trello Power Ups allow you to bring additional features to Trello boards and integrate your favorite apps right into Trello. They can pull information and data from outside services directly into Trello. Only power ups made by Trello listed here are inscope for this program.
Note: Please report Calendar, Card aging, List Limits, Voting Power Ups to our Trello main program.

target_groups.name: Trello Third Party Powerups
target_groups.description_html:
Note on Trello Third Party Powerups

Trello Third Party Powerups are not officially under Atlassian ownership and do not follow the normal bug bounty security assessments. However, we may consider rewards for vulnerabilities found in Trello Third Party Powerups on a case by case basis if the vulnerability can affect Trello customers outside of the third party powerup (e.g. a valid XSS attack that can steal the Trello token of victim users).

The amount of the reward is based on the usage of the powerup and severity of the report and is much lower than the typical Trello reward. We typically reward only valid High and Critical (P2 and P1) severity reports.

Atlassian holds the right to eliminate rewards for third party powerups at any given time.
